projects: [{"title":"Scotiabank: Customer Acquisition & Retention Strategy","start_date":"Apr 2024","end_date":"Apr 2024","description":"Project Scope :This project aimed to analyze Scotiabank customer data using SAS and present the findings at Deloitte's Toronto Office.Project Goals :- Identifying low, medium, and high-converting customers to tailor acquisition strategies with targeted incentives and marketing channels to maximize conversions and grow Scotiabank's customer base using a logistic regression model.- Identify key segments to develop cross-selling strategies with targeted promotions to encourage customers with only one product to acquire additional Scotiabank products utilizing clustering analysis.Project Outcome :- Focusing on customers in Ontario, Alberta, and British Columbia, prioritizing key age groups (25-35, 35-45, 45-55, and 55-65) with personalized levels of marketing for each customer category.- Utilizing email campaigns with e-statement integrations to deliver personalized offers and leverage mobile app notifications to cross-sell to customers holding one product."},{},{},{},{},{"title":"Sysco: Market Penetration and Expansion in the Sustainability Industry","start_date":"Jan 2024","end_date":"Mar 2024","description":"Project Scope :This project was for the Systems Thinking class at Ivey, where my team and I work as consultants for Sysco to help them penetrate and expand into the sustainability market through business operations optimization.Project Goals :- Defining what sustainability means and assigning standard metrics for each product category of Sysco.- Revamping and optimizing the value chain of sysco by keeping sustainability at its core.- Helping Sysco to raise awareness about their 'One Planet One Table' initiative.- Aligning the UN SDG goals with Sysco's value proposition and including a new initiative called 'Sysconsulting'.Project Outcome :- More awareness about sustainability from both the supplier and the customer end.- Better product placement and promotion strategy.- Setting a standard for the establishment of the sustainability ecosystem."},{},{},{},{},{"title":"An Empirical Study on Bangladesh Bank's On-site & Off-site Supervision","start_date":"Jan 2022","end_date":"Mar 2022","description":"Project Scope :This project was a part of my internship at Bangladesh Bank, the central bank of Bangladesh, where I analyzed the systematic process of on-site and off-site inspection of different commercial banks and non-bank financial institutions by Bangladesh Bank.Project Goals :- The main purpose of the project was to understand the systematic process of on-site and off-site supervision by Bangladesh Bank- To find the scope of improvements in the process- Scrutinize the financial performance of some banks through CAMELS Rating- To understand the performance of the banking sector of the country firsthand.Project Outcome :- Got to understand the thorough process of banking inspection- Collaborated in preparing a comprehensive inspection report- Recommended steps to improve the efficiency of the supervision process."},{},{},{"title":"Sustainable Business Guideline for Fayetteville, Arkansas","start_date":"Aug 2021","end_date":"Dec 2021","description":"Project Scope :For the Sustainable Business Guideline project, we chose to focus on the Graduate Hotel located in Fayetteville, Arkansas. The main point of focus in the Graduate hotel is its restaurant, Trophy Room, which is a signature food and beverage concept for Graduate Hotels across the country. The purpose of the sustainable business guideline project is to create a basic guideline model to promote sustainability practices for businesses to follow in the city of Fayetteville. This guideline will offer and include ideas, promotions, practices, incentives, and recommendations to persuade businesses, from small local companies to big corporations in Northwest Arkansas. Fayetteville, Arkansas is already known to be a very sustainable city; however, we want to help businesses optimize their ideas and practices of sustainability so the whole community can make a positive impact on the environment.Project Goals :- To encourage the use of recyclable packaging instead of styrofoam- To reduce paper wastage by shifting to e-receipts - To recommend the sourcing of ingredients from the local market- To bring technological innovation in sustainability practicesProject Outcome :Trophy Room already takes advantage of some sustainability practices; however, there is always room for improvement. Throughout this process, we have been able to cooperate and build camaraderie to create a well-fit sustainability business guideline for the Trophy Room restaurant. With our goal in mind and our cooperation with Trophy Room, we expect this business to work on implementing the ideas we have presented to them due to their desire to make a difference in the environment and to make business impactful for them."},{},{},{},{},{},{"title":"Shadow Pandemic","start_date":"Dec 2020","end_date":"Feb 2021","description":"Project Scope :According to a survey by the Bangladesh Bureau of Statistics and the United Nations Population Fund, over 70 percent of married women or girls in Bangladesh have faced some form of intimate partner abuse; about half of whom say their partners have physically assaulted them. Since the outbreak of the virus, emerging data from the front lines have shown that violence against women and girls, particularly domestic violence has significantly grown. This is the Shadow Pandemic growing amidst the Covid-19 outbreak and due to a strain on essential health services, domestic violence shelters and helplines globally have reached their capacities.Project Goals :- The main purpose of the campaign was to raise awareness about gender based violence among young people.- Highlight the importance of support groups in victim recovery.- Create a safe space where survivors can share their experiences and find the answers which people are looking for through their engagement.- To educate the masses on domestic violence and make people understand its gravity.- Explain the role of youth to combat Gender Based Violence (GBV) as kids might grow up in a toxic environment and we want to nudge the youth in the right direction.Project Outcome :- We initiated a dialogue on domestic violence and consent among the youth.- Various solutions were also gathered from the participants in the breakout rooms on eradicating this problem from the society.- We tried to educate the young people, the institutions to reach out to people if they need support in combating domestic abuse.- We understood the characteristics and persona of the abuser and their way of manipulation.To know more visit : https://www.thedailystar.net/shout/bulletin-board/news/aiesec-bangladesh-educates-the-youth-through-shadow-pandemic-campaign-2057537"},{},{},{},{},{"title":"Wonsulting Project 2020","start_date":"Jul 2020","end_date":"Sep 2020","description":"Project scope : As part of the WonsultingProject2020, we pitched Agora Media as consultants, to support them in building their branding strategy to enhance and develop their revenue generating tool.Project purposes :-To increase Agora Media’s brand recognition-Develop deeper understanding of social selling business model-To enhance brand’s existing credibility in the marketplaceWonsultingProject2020 goal :Initiating a project with a company that operates in the US and advocates its uniqueness through social selling concept. By combining teams’ expertise and experience from Asian markets, advancing the project to instill brand’s presence. This will further support Agora Media in developing market strategy that fits into social selling business model across the US market."},{},{},{},{"title":"Level5","start_date":"Apr 2020","end_date":"Apr 2020","description":"Project Scope:We participated in the Techstars Startup Weekend at Sacred Heart University in the US and as a part of the competition we have to launch a start-up of our own within three days. So, we came up with an idea to help the small businesses that got affected due to the pandemic. We wanted to create a gamification platform where people will participate in doing social good by spending their money on the products and services of those businesses and also get points for that which can be used later on to get good deals in different places.Project Outcome:- We surveyed people from USA, Bangladesh, India, China, Kosovo etc. to see the feasibility- We created prototype by launching a website- Secured the 2nd Runners-up position- Got mentorships from industry leadersTechstars Startup Weekend Goals:Startup Weekend is a three-day program where aspiring entrepreneurs can experience startup life. It happens in different cities around the world to find innovative solutions for different real life problems. It engages and pushes the aspiring entrepreneurs in challenging situations and mentors them to bring viable solutions to different problems. The final day is called the 'Demo Day' where the participants pitch in front of a panel of judges."},{},{},{}]

honors_and_awards.title: Ivey MSc Excellence Award
honors_and_awards.description: This award is given to students who have outstanding academic and extra-curricular activities, and who have decided to pursue their Masters at Ivey.

honors_and_awards.title: Arkansas Traveler Award
honors_and_awards.description: This award is given to people who successfully represent their culture at least twice through various on-campus events.

honors_and_awards.title: Chancellor's Community Service Award
honors_and_awards.description: I received the Chancellor's Community Service Award for volunteering 57 hours during the fall term.

honors_and_awards.title: Chancellor's List
honors_and_awards.description: I got into the Chancellor's List for Fall '21 for getting straight As (GPA 4.0) in all of my courses (12 credits).

honors_and_awards.title: Semi-finalist at Battle of Minds (BOM)
honors_and_awards.description: I was one of the Semi-finalists of the most coveted business competitions in Bangladesh, organized by British American Tobacco (BAT)

honors_and_awards.title: 2nd Runners Up in Techstars Startup Weekend at Sacred Heart University
honors_and_awards.description: I participated in the Techstars Startup, one of the most widely known starup competitions around the globe where I got to work with a diverse team and brought an idea into reality within just 54 hours

honors_and_awards.title: Global UGRAD 20.21 Finalist
honors_and_awards.publication: US Department of State & World Learning
honors_and_awards.description: I got selected for the prestigious Global UGRAD Exchange Program to study for a semester at the University of Arkansas, fully funded by the U.S. Department of State.

honors_and_awards.title: Finalist at BizPro in The University of Comilla
honors_and_awards.description: An inter-university business case competition arranged by The University of Comilla where team managed to compete in the final round.

honors_and_awards.title: Government Merit Scholarship
honors_and_awards.description: This scholarship is given to students who show outstanding result in their Higher Secondary Certificate (HSC) exam. Only a few selective students get the scholarship from all over the country
